summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written in the prophets,
“Behold, I send my messenger before your face,
    who will prepare your way before you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the voice of one crying in the wilderness,
    ‘Make ready the way of the Lord!
    Make his paths straight!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching the baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was clothed with camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He preached, saying, “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice came out of the sky, “You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of God’s Kingdom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and God’s Kingdom is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew, the brother of Simon, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are: the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came and took her by the hand and raised her up. The fever left her immediately, and she served them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick and those who were possessed by demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the city was gathered together at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He healed many who were sick with various diseases and cast out many demons. He didn’t allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place, and prayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and those who were with him searched for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found him and told him, “Everyone is looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Let’s go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him, “If you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him, “I want to. Be made clean.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When he had said this, immediately the leprosy departed from him and he was made clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He strictly warned him and immediately sent him out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “See that you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places. People came to him from everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that he was at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even around the door; and he spoke the word to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But there were some of the scribes sitting there and reasoning in their hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why does this man speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said to them, “Why do you reason these things in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Arise, and take up your bed, and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralytic—
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He arose, and immediately took up the mat and went out in front of them all, so that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office. He said to him, “Follow me.” And he arose and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, “Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him, “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can’t fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast in that day.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one puts new wine into old wineskins; or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees said to him, “Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Did you never read what David did when he had need and was hungry—he, and those who were with him?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: How he entered into God’s house at the time of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the show bread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there whose hand was withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They watched him, whether he would heal him on the Sabbath day, that they might accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the man whose hand was withered, “Stand up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good or to do harm? To save a life or to kill?” But they were silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples; and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, from Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Jerusalem, from Idumaea, beyond the Jordan, and those from around Tyre and Sidon. A great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke to his disciples that a little boat should stay near him because of the crowd, so that they wouldn’t press on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had healed many, so that as many as had diseases pressed on him that they might touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him and cried, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sternly warned them that they should not make him known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up into the mountain and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them out to preach
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James the son of Zebedee; and John, the brother of James, (whom he called Boanerges, which means, Sons of Thunder);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
Then he came into a house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him; for they said, “He is insane.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He has Beelzebul,” and, “By the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He summoned them and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can’t stand, but has an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder unless he first binds the strong man; then he will plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Most certainly I tell you, all sins of the descendants of man will be forgiven, including their blasphemies with which they may blaspheme;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is subject to eternal condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: —because they said, “He has an unclean spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him, “Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does the will of God is my brother, my sister, and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he began to teach by the seaside. A great multitude was gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat in the sea and sat down. All the multitude were on the land by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! Behold, the farmer went out to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell into the good ground and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some produced thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “To you is given the mystery of God’s Kingdom, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ‘seeing they may see and not perceive, and hearing they may hear and not understand, lest perhaps they should turn again, and their sins should be forgiven them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Don’t you understand this parable? How will you understand all of the parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmer sows the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones by the road are the ones where the word is sown; and when they have heard, immediately Satan comes and takes away the word which has been sown in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These in the same way are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have no root in themselves, but are short-lived. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others are those who are sown among the thorns. These are those who have heard the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the cares of this age, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those which were sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, accept it, and bear fruit, some thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Is a lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Isn’t it put on a stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is nothing hidden except that it should be made known, neither was anything made secret but that it should come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you; and more will be given to you who hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever has, to him more will be given; and he who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “God’s Kingdom is as if a man should cast seed on the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, though he doesn’t know how.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the earth bears fruit by itself: first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the fruit is ripe, immediately he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “How will we liken God’s Kingdom? Or with what parable will we illustrate it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, though it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet when it is sown, grows up and becomes greater than all the herbs, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without a parable he didn’t speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he explained everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, when evening had come, he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaving the multitude, they took him with them, even as he was, in the boat. Other small boats were also with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A big wind storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so much that the boat was already filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion; and they woke him up and asked him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are dying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He awoke and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!” The wind ceased and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were greatly afraid and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him out of the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him any more, not even with chains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him, and the fetters broken in pieces. Nobody had the strength to tame him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and crying out with a loud voice, he said, “What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don’t torment me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked him, “What is your name?”
He said to him, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He begged him much that he would not send them away out of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the mountainside there was a great herd of pigs feeding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the demons begged him, saying, “Send us into the pigs, that we may enter into them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed down the steep bank into the sea, and they were drowned in the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who fed the pigs fled, and told it in the city and in the country.
The people came to see what it was that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jesus, and saw him who had been possessed by demons sitting, clothed, and in his right mind, even him who had the legion; and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who saw it declared to them what happened to him who was possessed by demons, and about the pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to beg him to depart from their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was entering into the boat, he who had been possessed by demons begged him that he might be with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He didn’t allow him, but said to him, “Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you and how he had mercy on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side, a great multitude was gathered to him; and he was by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, came; and seeing him, he fell at his feet
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and begged him much, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain woman who had a discharge of blood for twelve years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and had suffered many things by many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better, but rather grew worse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having heard the things concerning Jesus, came up behind him in the crowd and touched his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she said, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to him, “You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked around to see her who had done this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler’s house, saying, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Don’t be afraid, only believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He allowed no one to follow him except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to the synagogue ruler’s house, and he saw an uproar, weeping, and great wailing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had entered in, he said to them, “Why do you make an uproar and weep? The child is not dead, but is asleep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ridiculed him. But he, having put them all out, took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Taking the child by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha cumi!” which means, being interpreted, “Girl, I tell you, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the girl rose up and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He strictly ordered them that no one should know this, and commanded that something should be given to her to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath had come, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many hearing him were astonished, saying, “Where did this man get these things?” and, “What is the wisdom that is given to this man, that such mighty works come about by his hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” So they were offended at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He marveled because of their unbelief.
He went around the villages teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called to himself the twelve, and began to send them out two by two; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, except a staff only: no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Wherever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever will not receive you nor hear you, as you depart from there, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony against them. Assuredly, I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out and preached that people should repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Herod heard this, for his name had become known, and he said, “John the Baptizer has risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others said, “He is Elijah.” Others said, “He is a prophet, or like one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Herod, when he heard this, said, “This is John, whom I beheaded. He has risen from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod himself had sent out and arrested John and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, for he had married her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John had said to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herodias set herself against him and desired to kill him, but she couldn’t,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and kept him safe. When he heard him, he did many things, and he heard him gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a convenient day came when Herod on his birthday made a supper for his nobles, the high officers, and the chief men of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and those sitting with him. The king said to the young lady, “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He swore to her, “Whatever you ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask?”
She said, “The head of John the Baptizer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came in immediately with haste to the king and requested, “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptizer on a platter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king was exceedingly sorry, but for the sake of his oaths and of his dinner guests, he didn’t wish to refuse her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the king sent out a soldier of his guard and commanded to bring John’s head; and he went and beheaded him in the prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the young lady; and the young lady gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his disciples heard this, they came and took up his corpse and laid it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles gathered themselves together to Jesus, and they told him all things, whatever they had done, and whatever they had taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Come away into a deserted place, and rest awhile.” For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went away in the boat to a deserted place by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They saw them going, and many recognized him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came out, saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them because they were like sheep without a shepherd; and he began to teach them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was late in the day, his disciples came to him and said, “This place is deserted, and it is late in the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and villages and buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he answered them, “You give them something to eat.”
They asked him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give them something to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go see.”
When they knew, they said, “Five, and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them that everyone should sit down in groups on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish; and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves, and he gave to his disciples to set before them, and he divided the two fish among them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and also of the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he made his disciples get into the boat and go ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he himself sent the multitude away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had taken leave of them, he went up the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening had come, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and he was alone on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing them distressed in rowing, for the wind was contrary to them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea; and he would have passed by them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they, when they saw him walking on the sea, supposed that it was a ghost, and cried out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they all saw him and were troubled. But he immediately spoke with them and said to them, “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got into the boat with them; and the wind ceased, and they were very amazed among themselves, and marveled;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they hadn’t understood about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret and moored to the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had come out of the boat, immediately the people recognized him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ran around that whole region, and began to bring those who were sick on their mats to where they heard he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever he entered—into villages, or into cities, or into the country—they laid the sick in the marketplaces and begged him that they might just touch the fringe of his garment; and as many as touched him were made well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees and some of the scribes gathered together to him, having come from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they saw some of his disciples eating bread with defiled, that is unwashed, hands, they found fault.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For the Pharisees and all the Jews don’t eat unless they wash their hands and forearms, holding to the tradition of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They don’t eat when they come from the marketplace unless they bathe themselves, and there are many other things which they have received to hold to: washings of cups, pitchers, bronze vessels, and couches.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and the scribes asked him, “Why don’t your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with unwashed hands?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He answered them, “Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written,
‘This people honors me with their lips,
    but their heart is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They worship me in vain,
    teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For you set aside the commandment of God, and hold tightly to the tradition of men—the washing of pitchers and cups, and you do many other such things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Full well do you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother;’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘If a man tells his father or his mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is Corban,”’” that is to say, given to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “then you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or his mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: making void the word of God by your tradition which you have handed down. You do many things like this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called all the multitude to himself and said to them, “Hear me, all of you, and understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing from outside of the man that going into him can defile him; but the things which proceed out of the man are those that defile the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had entered into a house away from the multitude, his disciples asked him about the parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Are you also without understanding? Don’t you perceive that whatever goes into the man from outside can’t defile him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it doesn’t go into his heart, but into his stomach, then into the latrine, making all foods clean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “That which proceeds out of the man, that defiles the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from within, out of the hearts of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, sexual sins, murders, thefts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: covetings, wickedness, deceit, lustful desires, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, and foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these evil things come from within and defile the man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there he arose and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon. He entered into a house and didn’t want anyone to know it, but he couldn’t escape notice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a woman whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell down at his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. She begged him that he would cast the demon out of her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to her, “Let the children be filled first, for it is not appropriate to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she answered him, “Yes, Lord. Yet even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “For this saying, go your way. The demon has gone out of your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went away to her house, and found the child having been laid on the bed, with the demon gone out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he departed from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the sea of Galilee through the middle of the region of Decapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought to him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech. They begged him to lay his hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took him aside from the multitude privately and put his fingers into his ears; and he spat and touched his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking up to heaven, he sighed, and said to him, “Ephphatha!” that is, “Be opened!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was released, and he spoke clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them that they should tell no one, but the more he commanded them, so much the more widely they proclaimed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were astonished beyond measure, saying, “He has done all things well. He makes even the deaf hear and the mute speak!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, when there was a very great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to himself and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have stayed with me now three days and have nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come a long way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples answered him, “From where could one satisfy these people with bread here in a deserted place?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?”
They said, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground, and he took the seven loaves. Having given thanks, he broke them and gave them to his disciples to serve, and they served the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also had a few small fish. Having blessed them, he said to serve these also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate and were filled. They took up seven baskets of broken pieces that were left over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had eaten were about four thousand. Then he sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he entered into the boat with his disciples and came into the region of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees came out and began to question him, seeking from him a sign from heaven and testing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sighed deeply in his spirit and said, “Why does this generation seek a sign? Most certainly I tell you, no sign will be given to this generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left them, and again entering into the boat, departed to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They forgot to take bread; and they didn’t have more than one loaf in the boat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He warned them, saying, “Take heed: beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They reasoned with one another, saying, “It’s because we have no bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, perceiving it, said to them, “Why do you reason that it’s because you have no bread? Don’t you perceive yet or understand? Is your heart still hardened?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having eyes, don’t you see? Having ears, don’t you hear? Don’t you remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I broke the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?”
They told him, “Twelve.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When the seven loaves fed the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?”
They told him, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Don’t you understand yet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to him and begged him to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village. When he had spat on his eyes, and laid his hands on him, he asked him if he saw anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked up, and said, “I see men, but I see them like walking trees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then again he laid his hands on his eyes. He looked intently, and was restored, and saw everyone clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent him away to his house, saying, “Don’t enter into the village, nor tell anyone in the village.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went out, with his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, “Who do men say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “John the Baptizer, and others say Elijah, but others, one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
Peter answered, “You are the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them that they should tell no one about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke to them openly. Peter took him and began to rebuke him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, turning around and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said, “Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the multitude to himself with his disciples and said to them, “Whoever wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does it profit a man to gain the whole world and forfeit his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what will a man give in exchange for his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man also will be ashamed of him when he comes in his Father’s glory with the holy angels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste death until they see God’s Kingdom come with power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John, and brought them up onto a high mountain privately by themselves, and he was changed into another form in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His clothing became glistening, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah and Moses appeared to them, and they were talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he didn’t know what to say, for they were very afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were coming down from the mountain, he commanded them that they should tell no one what things they had seen, until after the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept this saying to themselves, questioning what the “rising from the dead” meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, saying, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Elijah indeed comes first, and restores all things. How is it written about the Son of Man, that he should suffer many things and be despised?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him, greeted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked the scribes, “What are you asking them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the multitude answered, “Teacher, I brought to you my son, who has a mute spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and wherever it seizes him, it throws him down; and he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to cast it out, and they weren’t able.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered him, “Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked his father, “How long has it been since this has been happening to him?”
He said, “From childhood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Often it has cast him both into the fire and into the water to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears, “I believe. Help my unbelief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that a multitude came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to him, “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and never enter him again!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After crying out and convulsing him greatly, it came out of him. The boy became like one dead, so much that most of them said, “He is dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took him by the hand and raised him up; and he arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we cast it out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This kind can come out by nothing but by prayer and fasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out from there and passed through Galilee. He didn’t want anyone to know it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he was teaching his disciples, and said to them, “The Son of Man is being handed over to the hands of men, and they will kill him; and when he is killed, on the third day he will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t understand the saying, and were afraid to ask him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Capernaum, and when he was in the house he asked them, “What were you arguing among yourselves on the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were silent, for they had disputed with one another on the way about who was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sat down and called the twelve; and he said to them, “If any man wants to be first, he shall be last of all, and servant of all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took a little child and set him in the middle of them. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever receives one such little child in my name receives me; and whoever receives me, doesn’t receive me, but him who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone who doesn’t follow us casting out demons in your name; and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Don’t forbid him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name and be able quickly to speak evil of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever is not against us is on our side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name because you are Christ’s, most certainly I tell you, he will in no way lose his reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if he were thrown into the sea with a millstone hung around his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having your two hands to go into Gehenna, into the unquenchable fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna, into the fire that will never be quenched—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your eye causes you to stumble, throw it out. It is better for you to enter into God’s Kingdom with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, with what will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan. Multitudes came together to him again. As he usually did, he was again teaching them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “What did Moses command you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “For your hardness of heart, he wrote you this commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will join to his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two will become one flesh, so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the house, his disciples asked him again about the same matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman herself divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were bringing to him little children, that he should touch them, but the disciples rebuked those who were bringing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation and said to them, “Allow the little children to come to me! Don’t forbid them, for God’s Kingdom belongs to such as these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, whoever will not receive God’s Kingdom like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took them in his arms and blessed them, laying his hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him, “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one—God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not give false testimony,’ ‘Do not defraud,’ ‘Honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Teacher, I have observed all these things from my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looking at him loved him, and said to him, “One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, taking up the cross.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answered again, “Children, how hard it is for those who trust in riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, looking at them, said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter began to tell him, “Behold, we have left all and have followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time: houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand and one at your left hand, in your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to him, “We are able.”
Jesus said to them, “You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant toward James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus summoned them and said to them, “You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever of you wants to become first among you shall be bondservant of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man also came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out and say, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many rebuked him, that he should be quiet, but he cried out much more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus stood still and said, “Call him.”
They called the blind man, saying to him, “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?”
The blind man said to him, “Rabboni, that I may see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.” Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him and bring him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs him;’ and immediately he will send him back here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those who stood there asked them, “What are you doing, untying the young donkey?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to them just as Jesus had said, and they let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the young donkey to Jesus and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees and spreading them on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who went in front and those who followed cried out, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!” and his disciples heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables and the seats of those who sold the doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught, saying to them, “Isn’t it written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? But you have made it a den of robbers!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, he went out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, remembering, said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn’t doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening, he shall have whatever he says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone; so that your Father, who is in heaven, may also forgive you your transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they began saying to him, “By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John—was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we should say, ‘From heaven;’ he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we should say, ‘From men’”—they feared the people, for all held John to really be a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They answered Jesus, “We don’t know.”
Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the wine press, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was time, he sent a servant to the farmer to get from the farmer his share of the fruit of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent another, and they killed him, and many others, beating some, and killing some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those farmers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took him, killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Haven’t you even read this Scripture:
‘The stone which the builders rejected
    was made the head of the corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This was from the Lord.
    It is marvelous in our eyes’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tried to seize him, but they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spoke the parable against them. They left him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sent some of the Pharisees and the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had come, they asked him, “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and don’t defer to anyone; for you aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall we give, or shall we not give?”
But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius, that I may see it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They brought it.
He said to them, “Whose is this image and inscription?”
They said to him, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus answered them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
They marveled greatly at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection, came to him. They asked him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us, ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife behind him, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second took her, and died, leaving no children behind him. The third likewise;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the seven took her and left no children. Last of all the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Isn’t this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they will rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But about the dead, that they are raised, haven’t you read in the book of Moses about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are therefore badly mistaken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the scribes came and heard them questioning together, and knowing that he had answered them well, asked him, “Which commandment is the greatest of all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “The greatest is: ‘Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is like this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribe said to him, “Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to love him with all the heart, with all the understanding, all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from God’s Kingdom.”
No one dared ask him any question after that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, as he taught in the temple, “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David himself said in the Holy Spirit,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit at my right hand,
    until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?”
The common people heard him gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his teaching he said to them, “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk in long robes, and to get greetings in the marketplaces,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to get the best seats in the synagogues and the best places at feasts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. These will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A poor widow came and she cast in two small brass coins, which equal a quadrans coin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called his disciples to himself and said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, this poor widow gave more than all those who are giving into the treasury,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they all gave out of their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, gave all that she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, see what kind of stones and what kind of buildings!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are all about to be fulfilled?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, answering, began to tell them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he!’ and will lead many astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they lead you away and deliver you up, don’t be anxious beforehand or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not” (let the reader understand), “then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that your flight won’t be in the winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ don’t believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false christs and false prophets will arise and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you watch.
“Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
