verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender and produces its leaves, you know that the summer is near;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But of that day or that hour no one knows—not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don’t know when the time is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is like a man traveling to another country, having left his house and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know when the lord of the house is coming—whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest, coming suddenly, he might find you sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I tell you, I tell all: Watch!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now two days before the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception and kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they said, “Not during the feast, because there might be a riot among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard—very costly. She broke the jar and poured it over his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying, “Why has this ointment been wasted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” So they grumbled against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests, that he might deliver him to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. He sought how he might conveniently deliver him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare that you may eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent two of his disciples and said to them, “Go into the city, and there a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Get ready for us there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was evening he came with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they sat and were eating, Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, one of you will betray me—he who eats with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one, “Surely not I?” And another said, “Surely not I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “It is one of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man goes as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed it, he broke it and gave to them, and said, “Take, eat. This is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them. They all drank of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it anew in God’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said to him, “Although all will be offended, yet I will not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Most certainly I tell you that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he spoke all the more, “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.” They all said the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took with him Peter, James, and John, and began to be greatly troubled and distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here and watch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you. Please remove this cup from me. However, not what I desire, but what you desire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you watch one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went away and prayed, saying the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he returned and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy; and they didn’t know what to answer him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came the third time and said to them, “Sleep on now, and take your rest. It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise! Let’s get going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came—and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I will kiss, that is he. Seize him, and lead him away safely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had come, immediately he came to him and said, “Rabbi! Rabbi!” and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laid their hands on him and seized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain one of those who stood by drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me. But this is so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all left him, and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around himself over his naked body. The young men grabbed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he left the linen cloth and fled from them naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter had followed him from a distance, until he came into the court of the high priest. He was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witnesses against Jesus to put him to death, and found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony didn’t agree with each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some stood up and gave false testimony against him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, their testimony didn’t agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest stood up in the middle, and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is it which these testify against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he stayed quiet, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I am. You will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of the sky.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest tore his clothes and said, “What further need have we of witnesses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” They all condemned him to be worthy of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to tell him, “Prophesy!” The officers struck him with the palms of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the maids of the high priest came,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You were also with the Nazarene, Jesus!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you are saying.” He went out on the porch, and the rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The maid saw him and began again to tell those who stood by, “This is one of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he again denied it. After a little while again those who stood by said to Peter, “You truly are one of them, for you are a Galilean, and your speech shows it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he began to curse and to swear, “I don’t know this man of whom you speak!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the words that Jesus said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” When he thought about that, he wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders, scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, bound Jesus, carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
He answered, “So you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests accused him of many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate again asked him, “Have you no answer? See how many things they testify against you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate marveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner, whomever they asked of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was one called Barabbas, bound with his fellow insurgents, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should release Barabbas to them instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate again asked them, “What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cried out again, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has he done?”
But they cried out exceedingly, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They clothed him with purple; and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They struck his head with a reed and spat on him, and bowing their knees, did homage to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had mocked him, they took the purple cloak off him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They compelled one passing by, coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them that he might bear his cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought him to the place called Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, “The place of a skull.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn’t take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the third hour when they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The superscription of his accusation was written over him: “THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him they crucified two robbers, one on his right hand, and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Scripture was fulfilled which says, “He was counted with transgressors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads and saying, “Ha! You who destroy the temple and build it in three days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: save yourself, and come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, also the chief priests mocking among themselves with the scribes said, “He saved others. He can’t save himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe him.” Those who were crucified with him also insulted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which is, being interpreted, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Behold, he is calling Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to take him down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were also women watching from afar, among whom were both Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him and served him; and many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph of Arimathaea, a prominent council member who also himself was looking for God’s Kingdom, came. He boldly went in to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate was surprised to hear that he was already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him whether he had been dead long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses, saw where he was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were saying among themselves, “Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it was very big. Looking up, they saw that the stone was rolled back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe; and they were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Don’t be amazed. You seek Jesus, the Nazarene, who has been crucified. He has risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He goes before you into Galilee. There you will see him, as he said to you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out, and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had come on them. They said nothing to anyone; for they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went and told those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, they disbelieved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things he was revealed in another form to two of them as they walked, on their way into the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went away and told it to the rest. They didn’t believe them, either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward he was revealed to the eleven themselves as they sat at the table; and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they didn’t believe those who had seen him after he had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the Good News to the whole creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who disbelieves will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new languages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they will take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will in no way hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then the Lord, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
